docs.snippet: The actors Michael Elwyn, Rufus Wright and Geoffrey Beevers, cast members in “The Audience,” joined the author to talk about about soccer and baseball....
docs.lead_paragraph: The actors Michael Elwyn, Rufus Wright and Geoffrey Beevers, cast members in “The Audience,” joined the author to talk about about soccer and baseball.
docs.abstract: Joe Drape essay describes evening he spent with British actors Michael Elwyn, Rufus Wright and Geoffrey Beevers, cast members in Broadway play The Audience, who are all sports enthusiasts; holds there is international language that unites all sports enthusiasts, and it starts with healthy mistrust of wealthy owners.

headline.main: British Actors’ Broadway Run Includes Soccer and Baseball
headline.print_headline: British Actors’ Broadway Run Includes Soccer and Baseball

docs.abstract: Boston University goaltender Matt O’Connor, who lost track of crucial shot in team's 4-3 loss in Frozen Four title game, says he will not let mistake define him, and will instead use it as motivation.

docs.snippet: This millennium has more in common with the money-obsessed 1980s than we may think. It just has a little more scruff and a little less swagger....
docs.lead_paragraph: This millennium has more in common with the money-obsessed 1980s than we may think. It just has a little more scruff and a little less swagger.
docs.abstract: Teddy Wayne Future Tense column submits that contemporary narcissistic upper middle class people, while not saddled with 'yuppie' term widely used in 1980s, are still yuppies nonetheless; holds new yuppies have more varied personas than their predecessors and are more concerned with personal financial security than flagrant consumerism.

headline.main: Tell-Tale Signs of the Modern-Day Yuppie
headline.print_headline: Let’s Call a Yuppie a Yuppie

docs.snippet: Someday we’ll look back fondly on the days when our kids pretended not to know us....
docs.lead_paragraph: Someday we’ll look back fondly on the days when our kids pretended not to know us.
docs.abstract: Pamela Druckerman Op-Ed article notes, as an expat who has brought up her children in France, that she is constant source of embarrassment for them; suggests for Mother's Day that parents embrace their role as embarrassments to their children as it offers preparation for that time in their lives when they will become truly irrelevant to their children's lives.
